page.title: 08Housing in the Bramley area.
page.content: {Bramley}was formerly a{farming village expanding when{Silverwood Colliery opened.In 1985 it is a centre of {rapid urban development. The housing in Bramley is a{mixture of{old stone houses,}(mainly situated around the church and shops along Main Street and Bawtry Road),{Victorian {terraced houses,}and a large post_war {Council estate}of brick semi_detached houses which is built around the old centre and easily located by their tree names; Sycamore Ave, Cedar Drive etc{New houses surround the outskirts. A similar mix of houses is evident in Hellaby and Maltby, (at the far side of the M18 motorway).The newest houses reflect the change in buildings, using bricks, rather than stone, and a tiled roof instead of slates.Chimney pots have disappeared, to be replaced by central heating vents.
